The thai tea also had a bad batch of boba

However their gui cuon and the peanut sauce were pretty terrific
Amazing eggrolls and great flavor pho! Can't go wrong here! Clean, fast service and sooo good!

The pho is very good.  The broth, with its black licorice-like flavor is really outstanding.  The rare beef and tendon were also excellent (although the tendon wasn't chunked, it was stripped, which was a first).  My Vietnamese pork chop, while very good, didn't seem very Vietnamese (where was the ubiquitous red BBQ?).  I'll be back often.

Based on reviews here on Yelp, my son and I tried Khai Hoan tonight.it had the added benefit of being a short walk from my hotel.

The pho was among the best I've had, with some subtle difference in the spicing of the broth that elevated it well above normal. Service was quick, efficient, friendly, and unobtrusive. 

I highly recommend it.

I want to first say I don't come here for the service, I come here for their banh cuon, since it's one of the few places that seems to serve it. The service is "weird" for a lack of a better word, you're not really greeted or order confirmed verbally or with any expression. But you're not here for the service you're here for the food. I'm used to my banh coun having the meat being rolled into the rice paper but here they serve it on top. The banh cuon is plated over bean sprouts and lettuce, and the thit nuong is a little thin but the dish itself is still tasty. I would come back for the food!

Wow, I had the number one, large pho with everything, and I was just really impressed with the flavor and the amount of meat! I've only have one pho in Phoenix to compare to so far and this blew the other out of the water. I don't think pho should have a clear broth, this was cloudy and probably the reason it was very flavorful. And I love thinking I'm finished and all of a sudden a find more meat at the bottom! 

The service was quick too and the food came out soon after we ordered. 

Btw, minimum $10 order to pay with a credit card!

Hands down the best Pho I've had thus far in Arizona! Drove from Northern Phoenix and found the food well worth the drive. 

Came in with a couple of gals to have Pho for lunch and came in with big appetites. We decided to start with Egg Rolls (Cha Gio) and Veggie Spring Rolls because we were super hungry and we had a Vegan with us. For the main entree, I opted for my personal favorite: Pho Tai, simple bowl of Pho with thin raw slices of beef and typically topped with onions and/or green onions.

The Egg Rolls came out fresh and piping hot, filled with Wood Ear mushroom, meat and a bit of veg and served with dipping sauce. These also come out with a few cucumbers, perilla and lettuce to eat with the Egg Rolls. Two thumbs up for scalding hot egg rolls, delicious in flavor and pretty big in size.

Pho Tai came out in a small sized bowl, but filled with noodles, a beautiful brown broth, slices of thin beef and sliced green onions. Don't be fooled by the small bowl, it holds a good amount of noodles and broth nearly at the brim. The broth was absolutely delicious and as close in flavor to the Pho I was raised on and can be found in the Bay Area. Good balance or savory, sweet and aromatic. The pieces of beef were actually really tender and soft to eat, I've found that some places provide really tough slices of beef which ruins the eating experience. Another good sign here is the freshness and abundance of greens served along side your Pho. Here they serve a good amount of bean sprouts, lime, jalapeno, mint and Thai basil. So go right ahead and pile what you want in your Pho and I don't care who says it, go ahead and add Hoisin and Sriracha to your soup. You're the one eating it!

Service here is expected from most Vietnamese establishments, pretty casual and informal. It's not uncommon to see owners, staff members or family having their lunch at tables in plain sight or on their phone. Though it's the type of environment that's not found in corporate or chain restaurants, these mom and pop shops serve up what's real. The man serving us was great, he took our orders, refilled waters and was always an earshot away if we needed anything. Definitely, would come back. Don't judge this place by it's decor or casual service style, these bowls of soup are amazing! Came in hungry and practically had to roll out and with take out boxes!
Needed some fresh and authentic Vietnamese while in Phoenix. Had the Pho w/extra veggies. Spring Rolls were also delicious.

I am no Pho expert, but do try to satisfy my cravings once a week. Been to countless Pho places in different states, north/south Cal, Arz, Houston, Dallas, OKC, FL, Pho here is average, a little on the salty side and heavy on MSG. Customer service is also average, after my order was taken no other words came from any one there, not even "thank you, see you again" after I pay for my meal at the counter. Cafe sua da is below average, bland, almost no flavor. Gave 3 stars because there are worst Vietnamese "Pho" restaurants out there, much worst.

Decided to try this place out during my lunch break. Called in my order ahead of time. Walked right in and the lady asked if I called earlier and I said yes. My order was ready and didn't even wait a single minute to get my Pho, it was so good that I wanted more.  I would recommend this place to anyone that's in the Tempe area. Can't wait to go back again!

Hands down best Vietnamese restaurant of my life time. Yes, its a pretty damn GRAND introduction.  I live in Southern California but I make excuses to visit Arizona just to dine here. Everything is top notch from quality of the food to family oriented welcoming service here. Oh and of course pretty much EVERYTHING on their menu is epic. I have my normal "Four items" here which are
*Spring rolls
*Crab puffs
*Vietnamese ice coffee
*Pho 

Back in my AZ days I used to dine here lunch & dinner and me and my friends never got tired of this place EVER.

I have friend from Dubai that is dying to go back.

Nuff said.

Going to have to proclaim this my go-to after trying it. Ordered the #1 (super beef - has everything) and took it to-go with a couple of tips from the cashier on how to best serve at home and it turned out awesome. Fresh veges as always, and some tasty rice and meat to go with a bunch of delicious broth just about sums it up.
My favorite Vietnamese restaurant in the Valley. The family that owns it is very nice too. Get the Pho combo! Can't go wrong!

This had been one of my go to places to eat for close to twenty years! 
Best Pho in the valley! Tasty and fresh everytime! The menu has many safe and recognizable Vietnamese and Chinese items... Plus there are the adventurous Vietnamese items that take you to another place filled with yummy treats.
I love this place... And it's family owned. Yep they are all there everyday!

I usually eat Pho when I go to a Vietnamese restaurant and maybe I should have. The Com Tam Dac Biet was odd. The rice, shredded pork, grilled meat, pickled veggies were good; however, there was a weird looking patty meat, tasted good I guess, but I was just confused because I never had that on my Com Tam before. Also, the steamed egg was weird: it was super dry, yellow and gray in color, looked like a dry eraser. My friend said the Pho Ga was good. My other friend ordered broccoli and beef and it was a big portion (awesome), but it came out with like a yellow fried rice (he couldn't even explain it). We all ordered spring rolls, flavor was on point, but the rice paper was a little dry, making it tough to eat. I must commend this place on their great customer service though; they're always there to refill and take away whatever "trash" you have. I would go back to try out different items. Not everyday do you see a Vietnamese restaurant serve Banh Cuon, especially in AZ.
Amazing! I had the #18, my friend had the pho both were extremely flavorful! The staff is very friendly and the place is very clean. I recommend this place to anyone and I will be back!

Had the #3, rare beef. Great pho, probably some of the best I've had in Phoenix. Also had the spring rolls, which were great. I really like how they use larger pieces of grilled pork rather than the thinly sliced boiled stuff.

Very close to my work, so I'll definitely be back. However, my Phoenix favorite will remain Pho-Tan on 17th Ave. and Camelback.

I moved to AZ a few months ago from NYC, where I lived in a neighborhood of great Vietnamese restaurants, and have eaten my way through the Vietnamese enclaves in Boston and in Hong Kong -- and this place ranks up there with the best of them. You can tell how authentic a Viet place is by the condiments when you order: the right kind of basil, mint leaves, and limes. This place has all that correct, and their fish sauce is perfectly seasoned: not too sweet like some faux-Viet places, and just the correct color/taste. I'm lucky that it's down the block from my new home, and I can run in whenever I want. The pho is right-on, with really tasty and rich broth, and I also love the noodle cakes with grilled beef. 

Only complaint is that I find the price to  be slightly higher than what I'm used to in NYC (of all places!). But it's only about $1-3 off per entree, and I understand it may cost more to get their supplies to the desert.

Finally I found a good pho place around town.  It's not the best I've had but good.  I am a pho fanatic so I know what good pho taste like and not so good pho taste like.  

I just need to ask everyone one question.  Why do people add siracha and hoison in their pho?  Everyone does it and I don't understand.  You ruin the flavor of the broth.  Just a squeeze of lime is perfect.  If you want siracha and hoison, use the little side plates for the meat.

If you want good cheap food here's a place to go.
Went there with my son today. He was thinking back to when he was a freshman at ASU and went there. Food is still great. People are very quick and friendly. It was a good time today, thanks!
Second time to this place. Their Pho is very good, really fresh raw ingredients on the side, to customize your dish to your liking.
Delicious Pho! Definitely recommend stopping by for lunch or dinner. Veggie springs rolls were good too!

Love love love this place, the beef spring rolls and number 4 are my favorites. We eat here at least once a week and having tried at least 8 other Vietnamese restaurants in the valley this is our favorite. Great price amazing food and family owned. Good service too.

Best place for pho I have found in the valley. Get the #1 with everything: tripe, tendon, fatty flank, meatballs and the regular beef. Don't let the ingredients intimidate you. It's out of this world good!

If pho is in your future, be forewarned that the serving sizes are massive. I have never been able to polish off an entire bowl. So come extra hungry and skip the tempting spring rolls (also delicious with a killer spicy peanut sauce). Because if you've ever made the mistake of trying to stretch out a bowl of pho by taking half of it home, you know the disappointment that comes along with that cloudy bowl of watered down leftovers. Rice noodles just don't hold up well. Le sigh.

Lately I've taken to phoning in my order and picking up my Pho To Go (someone needs to snatch up that name, stat!) at the same price as the dine in option ($6-8). I have discovered the secret to pho longevity this way. Noodles and beefy parts are packaged separately and the broth is also in its own container. Nothing gets water logged and cloudy and I can easily make four meals out of one order. They toss in all the baggies of goodness too! Bean sprouts, basil, limes, jalapeno and mint in one; cilantro and spring onions in another. Hoisin and sriracha on the side. I seriously get hog wild with these additions. It's like a new bowl every time I try it!

FINALLY!! The best pho in AZ next to OC. Being an OC native I searched for some comfort food from home and have tried many but this place by far makes the best pho I've had in AZ. Will definitely be back to try other favorite Vietnamese dishes of mine.

A sober Saturday night when all my friends were out drinking led me to this restaurant. 30 minutes on the train and a 5 minute walk and I was here. Upon walking in, I had high hopes. 

Khai Hoan has the typical "we aren't trying to impress anyone" Vietnamese restaurant atmosphere. It was filled with a lot of Asian folks speaking their native tongue, unlike a lot of places full of whitey.  The woman who owns the place was very cordial and although her english was somewhat broken, she was tremendously helpful to me. A walk through the kitchen to wash my hands revealed how clean the place has to be kept. Obviously they wouldn't want anyone walking to the restroom and seeing a dirty kitchen. Hopes still high!

My bowl of bun came, #19 ($7.25) with egg rolls and pork, my usual bowl at any Vietnamese restaurant. Usually, the bowl is oversized, giving you room to mix up your ingredients once you put your favorite condiments on it. Unfortunately, the bowl was packed to the brim so I had to make some adjustments on how i eat the dish. As for taste, the overwhelming flavor of barbecue pork dominated everything in the bowl, which was a delicious flavor, but somewhat disappointing that I couldn't taste the sauce.

This restaurant is also in a pretty skeezy neighborhood. I'd forgotten how long it has been since I have encountered your run of the mill trailer park white crack/meth heads in public. They kind of scare me. I'd rather deal with a drunk bum anyday. 

+2 for the service 
-1 for the overwhelming taste of barbecue
-1 for the awful neighborhood

This one of my favorite spots for good Pho, the prices are very reasonable. I have to say though the place is very clean but also you can see all of the family helping out to cash register and cleaning tables. I had the Pho super bowl and it was amazing, the broth had great flavor without any chili but once you add the rest of the ingredients all the sweet and spicy flavors came to live. A must check out of your in the area of Tempe.

Had my first visit there this afternoon. 

Very good broth in that pho. I had a large bowl of the number one "everything" version (complete with tripe). The meat had been cooked long enough to be tender. The spring rolls were good but not that far above average.

Perhaps one of the best indications of a good ethnic restaurant: There were plenty of customers of the ethnicity in question. 

Service was very good. The spring rolls came out almost immediately as an appetizer, which differs from many other places I've been.

So yes, I'll be back.
this is the best thai/pho food around chandler area.....yes the environment are not 5 stars but food is really great....

Extremely fast and friendly!!

The one thing that sets this place apart from the other pho places is the speed and friendliness.

If you are craving good pho and your body is like, "Hey, I need pho now, can't wait!", then this is where you want to go. Once you order, it is in front of you in about 5 minutes, even on a busy sat night.

Not only that, but the owner here is super friendly and always is around for some good conversation.

I have been to my share of Phó places in the Valley but this is one of the best outside of California.  You can always judge a restaurant by it's clientele and this one had a range of ages and ethnicities. When you see an older executive sitting next to a large family of Vietnamese who are sitting next to college kids and business professionals, you know it has to be good.  The shrimp spring roll was good, the Phó was excellent and the Thai tea was okay. I think out of our meal the tea was the only part lacking. I will definitely come back for lunch again!

I stopped in for a bowl of beef pho and it was yummy... I'd give them more stars, but they practice a community type of setting with all silverware in a bucket at each table, and the fork I chose wasn't clean.  I just imagine everyone touching the utensils, not very appealing for me, but to each his own!
Let me think best spring rolls best egg rolls great pho best people so like the best my all time favorite for Vietnamese
Great pho and Ban xiau (crispy thin pan cake filled with a combination of sprouts, shrimp and meat). Super yummy and the best part is the Ban xiau comes with 2!

Amazing, plain and simple.

I don't quite have the experience that my girlfriend does when it comes to Pho (she grew up back east), but this place has the best Pho that I have tasted.  I took my girlfriend here to try it out because I saw the reviews here on yelp and I am glad that I did.  The food we had was amazing and we will definitely be going back for more.  

If you are in the mood for great Vietnamese food, Khai Hoan is the place to go.

Eating here almost made me feel like i was back in the bay area! Upon walking in, i remember my co-workers exclaiming in excitement,
"There are other ASIANS HERE! WOH! You even pay at the register!" 

That's authenticity roite thar.

I didn't think that i would be able to find an authentic asian restaurant in the phoenix area but this place proved me wrong. Not the best pho ever, but the best by far that i found in the area.

Oh god. Yes.

The Pho Tai here is pho king incredible.

Best in the pho king Valley.

Is ok. Nothing great here. Just an average Pho experience I would say.

This is a dove in a very divy part of town. Luckily the company I had was amazing and makes any meal great.

Side note: the opposite side of the same shopping center had the best Chicken Shwarma in town. Haji Baba. That place is bomb.
Friendly and fast service, plentiful portions, and great flavor! I was served the best Thai tea I have had. A recommendation sent me here with a guest and we had a wonderful time!

Awesome food! So fresh and delicious, the only bad thing I can think of is they are busy, which is a good thing because their food is amazing! Their spring roll is literally the best spring roll I have ever had only to be followed by many more! Oh one more thing, their peanut sauce... If I could get that in a bottle to use at home that would be one step closer to heaven!

The Pho is to die for! This is my go to place for comfort food, especially on chilly winter evenings. 

The broth is delicious,and, the pho has just the right amount of everything you would dig in for in a bowl of Pho! Don't go if plastic forks, lack of appealing decor or indifferent service bothers you. The Pho makes up for the lack of everything else (for me!), but, that may not be the case with everyone. The rest of you, head to Unphogettable, which also gets a four star, but, that rating relies on factors other than just the Pho.

I really wanted to give this restaurant a better rating, but it's hard when you see a cockroach on the wall next to your table! Having read many of the reviews, I caught at least 3-4 other reviews saying there were cockroaches either on the wall or on the TABLE (I would DIE if the latter happened to me). 

I understand it's a good place with good food, but I think they need to address this cockroach problem. I wanted to like it and make it my go-to Vietnamese place, but it's hard when I imagine cockroaches in the kitchen too (I just get the feeling that they KNOW they have this problem and they are not doing anything about it).

Also, I did not really like that the utensils were all hanging out at the table. I wasn't really sure how clean they were after being out there for God knows how long, and being exposed to God knows what!

Now with the food, I am not an expert on pho, but I did enjoy my chicken pho soup! However, I thought many of the chicken pieces were very tough to chew so that was annoying. We also got some yummy spring rolls. 

In summary, I would say 3.5 stars for food, and 1 star for being dirty (I also caught a few yelp comments that complained about dirty lettuce or veggies).
Very authentic viet cuisine. When you walk in, you know it's good just based on the smells. Service was great and food is still good after all these years.

Best Pho in town PERIOD!!

If you're looking for a great bowl of pho, this is the place to go.  Being Vietnamese myself and growing up on homemade Pho, and also coming from California where pho joints are a dime a dozen.  I know good pho when I taste it and I'm telling you if you live in the Valley, this is where you go to get the best pho in town.  I make pho at home all the time and I still can't perfect the soup the way Khai Hoan has, and that says a lot!  They also have really good Vietnamese egg rolls and spring rolls as well.  I love that Khai hoan offers other Vietnamese specialties like Banh Xeo ( vietnamese savory style crepes with meat and shrimp) and Bun Rieu too.  

This isn't your fancy shmancy kinda place, it's a wear your flip flops and shorts if you want kinda place, just don't come in wearing nothing but your undies cause well, let's be honest, no one wants to see that now do we? -=o)

Amazing little mom and pop shop that I've never seen devoid of customers and for good reason.  

Hands down the best pho I've ever had out to eat.  Fresh ingredients,  made quickly and oh so good.  Sometimes I dream about it.  

The fresh rolls they make are awesome as well. 

This place is fantastic for vegetarians.  While there are three vegetarian options,  they are never cross contaminated and taste amazing.  Also, the pho is all you need in your dining experience,  just saying.  It's that good. I can't emphasize enough,  try the pho (meat eaters and vegans). 

My boyfriend and I love dining here and we are able to suit both our diets with this menu.

A block or 2 from the main Arizona State campus, DL introduced me to this Vietnamese plaza-embedded eatery, offering the well-known Vietnamese dishes typically found nationwide.

But besides these common goodies, one that I've eaten for the very 1st time was called Banh Cuon, aka Vietnamese Rolled Rice Cake/Crepe.  You're probably thinking of something literally sweet: nope, it's at the polar region, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/khai-hoan-restaurant-tempe?userid=jQYIE9bjrh9EP-B5FXpqPw#4FC85Th0ookwRhbqJ8p1-Q.  Anyway, for DL it was his 2nd visit at Khai Hoan, & because I usually wanted the Pork & Egg Roll Vermicelli Bowl/#19 ($8.95) instead of Pho--the summer temperature further explained--he reordered the Banh Cuon Dac Biet Khai Hoan/#25 ($9.25), or in American terms Khai Hoan's House Rice Crepe.

My bowl was like every yummy Vermicelli Bowl I've devoured: excellently textured & filling meats, copiously bouncy noodles, and fresh veggies.  My major issue is that, based on many Vietnamese eats I've visited other than in CA (whether hole-in-the-wall standards or at popular status), at roughly 9 bucks it's the highest priced Vermicelli Bowl I've ever discovered--more than the cost found at my favorite place to get this hulk, located all the way in Minneapolis.  I looked at the prices of their Pho, too, & I'd rather save it for either in my home state or this local spot near DL's residence.

The next items slightly placed aside this concern.  Our drinks, i.e. our Thai Tea and French Press Iced Coffee, were at consistent value among other competitors U.S.-wide.  Both, to me, were sip-tastic, with the exception of the sub-average tapioca pearls.  As for the saved-for-last Banh Cuon, in spite of the monetary tag, this would be my only reason I would revisit.

The patted rice roll was consistently soft and uniformly thick without being mushy &/or too slippery.  Sandwiched in these rolls was some scrumptious stuffed ground pork.  For better complementary textures, we dove into the exact tastiness and texture of the grilled beef and egg roll, plus some thick very gnaw-friendly pieces of Vietnamese ham.  They were so tasty w/ the Vietnamese fish sauce that we made sure not to allow this platter go to waste, consequently expanding our bellies silly--though I do hope that there's an equally yummy version back in the OC.

Frankly, their prices are comparably steep, especially when you have a pleeeeeethora of Vietnamese restaurants scattered in either Southern Cali or metro Phoenix.  That said, I'd again be returning to this swell Tempe eatery when we both are cravin' for their signature soft & savory crepe.  In math terms: 2.5 stars for the price, 4.5 stars for Banh Cuon, plus 3 stars for everything else average out to 3 mixed stars.

Great prices and big portions with good service and consistent quality! 

Recommendations from locals: Grilled Pork Chop with Broken Rice and Tri-Color Dessert with yellow mung bean, red beans, and green gelatin strips

The Grilled Beef, Shrimp, & Egg Roll vermicelli was good. A bit too much rice noodles. I ended up throwing half it away...the noodle a bit soggy that what I'm use to but after the sauce it was no biggie. Overall, still pretty good!

being that i'm fully vietnamese and my mom has made all types vietnamese dishes ever since i was a kid, i have quite the tastebuds for authentic vietnamese food. also, growing up in so cal there are a lot more restaurants to choose from. 

for arizona, this place is probably one of the best authentic vietnamese restaurants in town. i always get their pho ap chao....even the owner knows this when i step foot in the door. :) their pho is really great..the broth is good, the beef is good, the noodles are good. everything is like it should be. their spring rolls are pretty decent. what i really like is it doesn't pretend to be something it's not. it's a hole in the wall place, but most good and REAL vietnamese places are. the food is great and the service is quick.

I absolutely LOVE this little place. The Pho is phenomenal! The broth was light and clean, yet complex and rich. We also ordered some lemon grass beef and that was cooked to perfection. The Thai tea was perfectly balanced and the price is good.
The environment is basic, and the service is somewhat spotty but the food is what makes me come back time and time again!

Nice to see some variety when it comes to Vietnamese! Doesn't hurt that it's DEEELISH as well. I had number 13 with egg noodles and the appetizer sampler. Nice variety of things in the number 13- wontons, BBQ pork, fish balls, surimi, and shrimp. Quality of BBQ pork and the wontons could improve- but I wasn't mad at it. Soup broth was really nice- drinkable on it's own. The appetizer sampler was great!

As we ate a huge cockroach crawled out of the spoon/folk dispenser on our table. Staff didn't appear fazed by this, we left our meals mid way and left the restaurant disgusted. We were charged the entire bill regardless of our experience. Interesting.

If you are debating about whether to try this place, Khai Huan will not let you down. The broth in the pho has a savory, comforting flavor, and the different types are all delicious. I had the #16 (sweet wonton), my friend had the #3 (pho tai with very tender beef). Reasonably priced at about $9 a bowl. Nice and friendly atmosphere.
most authentic Vietnamese restaurant. their pho broth is the best I've ever come across. highly recommended. my go to pho place.
They do not serve fresh Pho noodles.  Sorry, you got to have fresh pho noodles for the soup.  Not the dry kind that has been sitting around for years.  It makes a big differences.
Delicious and fast. This was my first time eating pho and it was superb. Friendly and clean

A weird hole in the wall family owned vietnamese/chinese place. I really only get pho there with some appatizers but after a few visits this became my favorite restaurant. A nice local casual feel with the best pho Ive ever had. You have to eat here

It has been a long time since I rarely make it down to ASU to eat since there are so many Vietnamese eatery there.  I have been there many times and they have always been great.  It is a little pricy compared to other Vietnamese venues but they do have Bun Cuon (rare treat that is a must here).  Their Pho were in par with local establishments.  The smile from the chef (older Viet lady) and bus person is great and I have a feeling that the tip went to the young kid who only took the order which it should have belong to the chef and the Mexican bus person who really provided the service.  May be I'll make a point next time to directly tip the person who really served me instead.  The owner said hi since he was doing electrical work, he was busy and couldn't serve me.  I will return whenever I have opportunities to run down there..It is extremely popular with ASU students so you will feel the vibrant energy there..Cool place to be.

This place has been around for many many years. When I go to this Plaza I either come here or go to Haji Baba. I usually get the bun which is the vermicelli noodle with choice of different meats and egg rolls and some vegetables underneath. The beef this time was a little tough but still seasoned nicely. Staff is run by the family which is very helpful. If you're in the neighborhood and you want good Vietnamese you should go and check them out. Plus everything on their menu is around $8 to $10 for nice size portions

Excellent food, good service, and great prices.  The pho is excellent, but frankly everything on the menu is very good.  I've started using it as my lunch meeting place and everyone I've taken there has been hooked!
The service was impeccable, and the food was really amazing. Large portions and super fast. Definitely coming again.

I've been to Khai Hoan two times now. The first time I got the number 5 and the second time I got the number 15. Both were excellent!

The service is fast, we didn't have to sit at the table for long before someone came over and took our order. Even getting the food didn't take to long. The beef in the number five was perfect, sliced thin and rare when it was put in so that the broth could cook it. 

The broth wasn't overly oily and you get a big plate of 'fixing's (like bean sprouts, lime and basil) for your soup.

Overall, this place was great--though I think the soup needs more meat on average.

I will go back for sure!

I absolutely love this place! Very unassuming little restaurant with delicious food. I have never eaten in, but we get take out at lunch a lot (we work close by). They have always been super quick with our order (we don't even have to call ahead) and we have never experienced the unfriendly service that I have read about in some of the other reviews; every time we have been in everyone has been very friendly.

I am from the northwest and may be a little bit pickier than most Arizonans when it comes to Asian food and this is the best Vietnamese food I have had in the desert. I love the pho and I really enjoy their fresh spring rolls as well. I have had the beef and seafood and they are both fantastic as far as Pho goes. 

My boyfriend ordered off the Chinese menu and said it was meh. Not impressed, so I wouldn't recommend it.

If you are looking for super casual and yummy comfort food stop in and enjoy some delicious soup!

Okay, this is my first review ever. Only writing one because I am so pleased with the pho here. This is the first pho place that had legit, authentic pho. And I'm from California.. little Saigon/Westminster area of orange county so I know what REAL pho tastes like. I ordered togo and was quite happy that they included everything I requested. Other places usually don't listen very well. They had the saté chili and the extra oil I requested on the side. The broth was quite flavorful compared to other pho broths I've had in Arizona. The meat was fresh and delicious. Everything was perfect. If you're looking for real, authentic pho in Tempe.. this is the place to go!!
I am a big fan of this place.   They got it right.  Pho is wonderful.  Price reasonable.

I've been here several times- I live about five mins away. I always leave super satisfied  pictured here are the spring rolls and Pho Tai. 

A great local place for pho  the service is always really fast and friendly. It has a great family run vibe while also being super high quality good. If you're looking for some awesome Vietnamese food that's well priced this is definitely the place to go!
Great food. Very authentic pho and spring rolls. Family owned, and very friendly. Lots of locals come here because the food is great!

The Pho here is perfect! It's become my comfort food...if I'm sick I'm eating a bowl of this vs. traditional chicken noodle. I e also tried several other items off their menu and haven't been disappointed. The staff is very helpful with questions and menu suggestions.

The Best Pho in the Valley. Hands down. Anyone who knows good Pho will tell you this. 

No, it's not a super fancy spot.
No, it's probably not the best looking restaurant
No, it's not a large expanse (You'll be lucky to get a seat)
Yes, it's hard to find.

But they know what they're doing. I will look past all the negative aesthetic drawbacks, and enjoy a bowl...because it's that good.

The broth is the most flavorful I have ever had the pleasure of slurping, the vegetables are the freshest I have ever snapped between my teeth, and the noodles are the most perfectly cooked (a little past el dente).

Order take out and enjoy it in the comfort of your well appointed kitchen, or living room for that matter. That's what I have done anyway.
By far .... The best Pho place around!  Tasty broth, plenty of meat & great service.  A must try.

It was a particularly chilly, grey day after an all nighter storm, and my boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place while desperately looking for "a place that makes huge bowls of soup". Not much for ambiance, of course, but the food - OH MAN. 7-8 bucks gets you a steaming large bowl of pho. Spring rolls weren't bad either!

The one thing that MIGHT bother people (just not me, because I've travelled around Asia a lot) is you'll have to walk to the end of the kitchen to get to the bathroom. It's not an unpleasant walk, and the bathroom is clean.

I am so glad I found this place! I'm new to Tempe and I had been dying to get my Vietnamese food fix! I decided to order takeout and I am so happy I did! The employee over the phone was very friendly and I got there in about 15 minutes and my food was ready. I ordered the spring rolls and pork rice vermicelli. So delicious! I think the portion sizes were perfect and the prices were pretty reasonable. Next time I plan on dining in and trying the Pho! I hate to get pho takeout so I truly need to get around to trying it. The restaurant is small but clean. I will 100% return and I give this place 5 stars for what it is. It's delicious, it's nimble, and its reasonable.

The pho was amazing! I was in search of a good pho place while being out of town. I was a little nervous because of how picky I am when it comes to pho. It is definitely a hole in the wall. I would recommend the #4 if you get pho. So amazing!
Love the PHO!  We recently moved here from Southern California the home of amazing pho and this is now our goto place. We have tried several and landed here.

I stopped by here due to other pho restaurants closing at 9pm, let me start off by saying bring your own water. The water they serve is absolutely the nastiest thing I've ever drank in my life, it makes tap water taste like wine. Now on to the food, I ordered a number 4, and the portion sizes are just ridiculously small here.. my bowl size is the size for child. The flavors were good, he broth tasted amazing and the meat was good. Overall, with the quality of the water and he small portion sizes, I would not come back here again. But the food was good.

I got the Bun Bo Hue. The portion was big, like any other Vietnamese restaurant. The meat in the soup was very very x3 hard. The beef slices were so hard that I couldn't eat chew on it. It was also dry and dark colored. I'm very sure it's old beef. Leftover beef and cooked again or something. It was honestly so hard that I'm a little scared now lol. They give you a lot of the meat, but then it just went to waste because I couldn't even eat it at all. I do like how they give you a lot of pork blood cubes, which are my favorite part of the dish. I felt like the broth needed more flavor to it. I had to put like two table spoons of fish sauce to the soup, which I normally do not. Maybe the soup just needed to be cooked longer so the flavor can build up. They had a $10 card minimum.

This is a small restaurant that I wouldn't have noticed if it wasn't because of my foodie friend. Apparently it has been around for quite many years. Staffs are friendly and food comes out quickly. I ordered a rare steak Pho for dinner. Portion is generous but unfortuntely the meat isn't rare and a bit overcooked. However, the broth is absolutely delicioius. I also ordered a dessert type or drink with 3 different types of beans in it. Again, it is sweet and delicious. I will come back here again to try different types of dishes
My favorite Pho place in AZ. I always ask for rare beef so I can cook it in the broth on the spot which makes it extra tender. Their crab puffs are the bomb.com
